alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SUWANNEE AND HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EST... At 1230 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 10 miles northeast of Perry, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Jennings, Suwannee River State Park, Dowling Park, Blue Springs, Crossroads, and Newburn. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Jacksonville. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for northern Florida.
